title: Asylum veneris, or A sanctuary for ladies Iustly protecting them, their virtues, and sufficiencies from the foule aspersions and forged imputations of traducing spirits.
author: D. T. (Daniel Tuvill), d. 1660.
publisher: Printed by Edward Griffin for Laurence L'isle, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head,
notes: Dedication signed: D.T., i.e. Daniel Tuvill.
A reply to: Swetnam, Joseph.  The araignment of lewde, idle, froward, and unconstant women.
Running title reads: A sanctuarie for women.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
